resources.string: no more map data this direction
"Do not show this hint again.\nTo reset, go to Settings->Support->Reset Hints"
Enable to display all preferences when opening settings
Specify how frequently bloodhound will check to see if a reroute needs to be calculated.
Specify the distance away from the route a point has to move before calculating a reroute.
Select a color to make grid-lines more visible
Select a color to make the Layer outlines more visible

Show danger close rings (prone and standing) as different colors. If disabled, standing position will be indicated in red (prone will not be displayed). If enabled, the standing position will be indicated in red and prone position will be indicated in yellow.
Enable communication with a device to send DCAS
Failed to create file. Does it already exist?
System still loading. Please try again.
When the "Send SMS" checkbox is checked and an alert is issued, these numbers will automatically receive an SMS.
Change the time between updates for markers being broadcasted. This feature needs to be selected in the Detail page for the marker. If the value is set to 0, then feature is disabled.
Display an Android notification during alert
Sound an audible alert during alert
Touch to check for app updates now
Enable to load plugins during startup
Used for keeping plugins and related applications up to date. Can be used with the default repository or a custom repository on an internal network.
Used for managing the Radio network interfaces
Used for managing the serial devices suchs as external GPS and Range Finders
Set the \'Update Server URL\' and then try again
Incompatible plugins were found on this device. Would you like to resolve these plugins?

Incompatible plugins were found on this device. During resolution, those plugins which have available updates, will be brought current. If no updates are available, that plugin will be uninstalled. Alternatively, you may manually resolve each plugin individually.
is installed, and the update is not compatible
is installed and an update is available
is loaded and the update is not compatible
is loaded and an update is available
is available to load locally, but the update is not compatible
is available to load locally, and an update is available
is not compatible but is available for install
is not compatible, but has an update available
Package is not available from the configured sources, please install manually or contact your system administrator
Directory on the local device containing app/plugin APKs to load
Display a notification whenever a new Chat message is received
Vibrate the phone whenever a new Chat message is received (notifications required)
Play default notification sound whenever a new Chat message is received (notifications required)
Write entire chat history to CSV file on disk
Retain chat groups between app restarts even if the group didn\'t originate from this device (restart required)
Address to send chat messages. Must match other GeoChat providers.
Port to send chat messages. Must match other GeoChat providers.
Remove all marker types from map when they stale out
Enable to delete all non-archival types from device when their stale-out time is reached. Items will be deleted based on \'Stale item clean up time\' below
Delete items from device after they\'ve been stale for this many minutes
Remove Unknown markers when they stale out
Enable to delete Unknown marker types from device when their stale-out time is reached
Quit when the back button is pressed
Prompt a dialog asking to quit instead of closing right out
Action for Long pressing the Map
Determines what occurs when long pressing the map.
If checked, double tapping the map (without dragging) will zoom in by 2X.
Enable Volume Keys rotating map layers
If checked, volume keys switch maps. Otherwise use device default volume behavior
If checked the keyguard will be disabled system-wide!

Force Airplane Mode on launch. This is only supported on certain older phones and probably will not work on newer devices running KitKat or newer. If the device does not turn off the radio or wifi on launch, it does not support this feature.
Use the maximum number of texture units
Uncheck if there are rendering issues with Markers and Labels
Uncheck if app crashes when zooming out on maps

If checked a log file will capture the Android (logcat) logging output while the app is running. The log file is generated in the app support directory, is named logcat.txt, and is overwritten after each run of the application.
If checked the log file will only capture error level diagnostic information while the app is running
If checked debug logs (Logcat and Network Traffic) will be uploaded to TAK Server
Set the color of the toolbar icons. Note: Some plugin icons may not blend well with the applied coloring.
Set the background color of the toolbar. Note: Background color will be transparent.
Reset Tool Bar Colors To Default
Resets the toolbar icon and background color back to the default settings.
Are you sure you want to reset all tool bar colors to default?
The selected color may not show up well on darker maps. Continue anyway?
Use the RGB sliders to select a color.
Specifies the role of this device
Specifies the type that the world shall see this device as
If true, the device will use GPS time when available.
Display phone number (if available) to other users and allow direct phone calls and SMS messages (if supported) by both devices
Specifies whether to publish VoIP address, and whether to configure automatically or manually
VoIP number or SIP address for VoIP calling. Leave blank to not publish
XMPP/Jabber chat username. Leave blank to not publish
Preferred email address. Leave blank to not publish
Send CoT event based on location gathering
Prepare for Cloning / Clear Device unique information
Adjust how this device reports its own position
Constant interval between reporting self-SA messages in seconds for unreliable protocols (e.g. multicast)
Report Location before obtaining location fix
If true, report SA message with (lat=0,lon=0) before either GPS fix or manual placement of self-marker.
Customize your location marker by color or size
Customize toolbar icon and background colors
Access preferences related to default display for units of measurement, angles, and coordinates.
Enables a visual Map Scale on the Map
Adjust scale line to the nearest power of 10
Enables large tool bar (top menu), icons, and text. Equivalent to enabling all 3: \'Large Tool Bar\', \'Icon and Text Size\', and \'Default Label Size\'
Enables larger buttons in the tool bar (top menu)
Relative scaling that gets applied to icons and text size
Default size of the font used for labeling entities in the Map. This will require a restart so all rendered entities can utilize the new font size.
Enables All Map Items To Dim/Brighten With The Brightness Tool
Adjust O.S. display preferences, including screen time out
Manage grid line behavior and appearance
Manage layer outline behavior and appearance
Default shape styles are set during import of data formats which have no style support (e.g. Shapefile, GPX)
Adjust Width/Height Of Overlay Manager Window
Incremental brightness for the program manually overriding Android Auto-Brightness
If checked the screen will always stay on while the program is running
If checked the softkeys lights will be disabled on platforms that support this. If not supported, this setting will not do anything.
Display Android notifications when receiving SA report from other users
Default time that a transient notification stays in the notification bar before being removed automatically
Display ETA on Range and Bearing Labels
If checked, an attempt will be made to compute ETA based on your range and current speed. If speed cannot be detected, it can be manually entered through the Range and Bearing details

Enable to add the Address tab for coordinate entry.
Enable to use the built-in Geocoder service.

Clear all application data during shutdown
Amount of seconds to wait for deletions to finish before forcing shutdown
Forces a clean and rescan of layer data
Use Frame Center elevation data provided in KLV instead of local elevation data.
Disallow transfer of files if total size (MB) is above this threshold
Number of times to attempt to download a file from the remote Server
Port of the file sharing Server
Secure Port of the file sharing Server
Re-Attempt the transfer if no connection is detected within this period (sec)
Re-Attempt the transfer if no progress is detected within this period (sec)
Allows for publication of a Data Package to any configured TAK server regardless of connection state.
Enable to display connectivity indicator on map above local device location widget
Enable to monitor connections and ping server after periods of network inactivity
The default PKCS12 keystore with your Certificate Authorities (.p12 file). May use this keystore for connections, or load per-connection CAs
The default PKCS12 keystore with your client Certificate (.p12 file). May use this keystore for connections, or load per-connection client certifcates
The default username and password for server connections. May use this for connections, or load per-connection credentials
Secure Port of the Server API
Unsecure Port of the Server API
Length in bits for RSA private key
Allows exporting of certificates obtained via enrollment
Enable to allow ATAK and plugins to import server profiles (e.g. settings and data) from TAK Server
Enable to allow multicast traffic. Disable to override and disable all inputs and outputs
Auto Manage Mesh Network Self SA Mode
Enable to automatically prefer sending data over the server if connected instead of the local mesh network. Recommended for some VPN configurations
If checked captures all outgoing network traffic to a Comma Separated Values (CSV) file

How long (in sec) to wait for TCP connections to complete. Shorter values make failed connections happen sooner (more responsive), but if the value is too short for your network then you may get spurious connection failures
Interval between Multicast rejoin attempts (in seconds). Zero indicates do not try to rejoin.

Unless instructed, do not enable Multicast Traffic Loopback unless you are using another application on the same device to listen to traffic being sent by this application. This will cause degradation in the performance of the network handling on this device because causes all outgoing traffic to be processed as incoming data to this application. Filters exist to protect this application from consuming data it is generating, but require resources to run.
Leave Multicast group before attempting to rejoin.
Multicast TTL for outgoing multicast (requires restart)
Select method of obtaining a location fix.

Network port to listen on for incoming GPS/position updates. This usually does not need to be modified; only modify this setting when directed to do so. For some radios, such as the PRC-161, where the positional data is sent out over the network - this field should not be modified.
Turn on scanning for bluetooth devices e.g. LRF and GPS
Number of seconds to attempt to reconnect dropped Bluetooth connections
Specify Initial Point using Keyhole CAS
Specify the port on which the server is currently listening
Enter the local port on which to receive CoT
Allow for editing the FAH whenever the FAH is visible.
The distance from viewpoint at which off-screen indicators won\'t show in KM, 0 for no threshold.

If a map item has been on the screen for more than the specified timeout and has not been touched, the offscreen indicator will be removed. Team members will always show an offscreen indicator. Zero will disable the timeout capability.
Set Timeout Threshold (seconds) or zero to disable
Value to prepend to all automatically generated checkpoint names
Sets The Initial Route Travel Type When Creating New Routes
Default color to use for an imported route from a format without a specified color. This does not apply to route formats that specify a color on import.
When inside of this distance to a checkpoint, you will be considered to be at the checkpoint while navigating
When inside of this distance to a checkpoint, you will be considered to be at the checkpoint while navigating
When inside of this distance to a checkpoint, you will be considered to be at the checkpoint while navigating
Check to show the North Reference units (\u00B0M) on bearing readings in doghouses. Uncheck to hide those units.
When inside of this distance to a checkpoint, you will be considered to be at the checkpoint while navigating
When inside of this distance to a checkpoint, you will be considered to be at the checkpoint while navigating
When outside of this distance, you will be considered off the route while navigating
Enable to interpolate elevation profile graph altitudes from nearby route points. Disable to use DTED altitudes for interpolated points.
Enable to focus map on elevation profile graph seeker marker (blue dot).
Enable to create checkpoint for each named GPX route point. Disable to create checkpoints only for GPX checkpoints along the route

If enabled, the exported route will not contain any elevation data and the user would need to provide their own altitude information which may have higher or lower accuracy. If disabled, the elevation data contained within the route will be written to the file.
Export check points as KML points, line, or both
Enable narration of navigational cues using text-to-voice
Auto Skip to Next Upcoming Checkpoint
If a way point is missed, automatically skip to the next closest upcoming way point

A network configuration file has been detected in the app directory, but the NetworkMonitor application is not installed. In a multi radio configuration, the NetworkMonitor is required. This can be installed with the link under Settings->Tool Preference->Plugin & App Mgmt->Network Monitor Application.\nRemoving the network configuration file.

Important Note - The specific device and operating system combination detected does not allow for the lockscreen to properly resume on when running this software. To configure your phone to correctly return after the screen is locked, go into Android Settings->Lock Screen->Secured lock time to \"Instantly with the power key or when the screen times out\" before continuing.

Important Note - Many versions of the Android Operating System contain an issue where the operating system gets stuck scanning multimedia files (map data, videos). We have detected a version on Android where we can fix this issue by disabling the process \"mediaserver\".

Important Note - The Android Operating system attempts to disable capabilities in order to save on battery usage, even during usage in operational scenarios.

 Please select **YES** or **ALLOW** when asked if you would like to disable optimizations or stop otimizing battery usage.

Failure to do so will result in poor user experience.
"You can read the End-user License Agreement (EULA) by clicking the button below. "
By clicking the \"I agree\" button you agree to the terms of the EULA.\n

This menu allows you to toggle Manual Orientation and 3D modes.\nIn 3D mode, tilt the map by scrolling with two fingers. Tap to engage the video overlay feature when the video has 4 corner points. When the video tool is minimized, this will allow for the video to be overlayed on the map. When the tool is reopened, the video will return to the tool. Note: The video overlay will only be as good as the corner coordinates transmitted from the platform.


The video must contain either
 MISB STD 0601 Offset Corner Latitude Point 1 (Tag 26)
 MISB STD 0601 Offset Corner Longitude Point 1 (Tag 27)
 MISB STD 0601 Offset Corner Latitude Point 2 (Tag 28)
 MISB STD 0601 Offset Corner Longitude Point 2 (Tag 29)
 MISB STD 0601 Offset Corner Latitude Point 3 (Tag 30)
 MISB STD 0601 Offset Corner Longitude Point 3 (Tag 31)
 MISB STD 0601 Offset Corner Latitude Point 4 (Tag 32)
 MISB STD 0601 Offset Corner Longitude Point 4 (Tag 33)
 

		— or —

 MISB EG 0104 Corner Latitude Point 1 (UL 	060E2B34010101030701020103070100)
 MISB EG 0104 Corner Longitude Point 1 (UL 	060E2B340101010307010201030B0100)
 MISB EG 0104 Corner Latitude Point 2 (UL 	060E2B34010101030701020103080100)
 MISB EG 0104 Corner Longitude Point 2 (UL 	060E2B340101010307010201030C0100)
 MISB EG 0104 Corner Latitude Point 3 (UL 	060E2B34010101030701020103090100)
 MISB EG 0104 Corner Longitude Point 3 (UL 	060E2B340101010307010201030D0100)
 MISB EG 0104 Corner Latitude Point 4 (UL 	060E2B340101010307010201030A0100)
 MISB EG 0104 Corner Longitude Point 4 (UL 	060E2B340101010307010201030E0100)

Display mobile imagery with traditional datasources

Allows for non-overlapping mobile imagery to be displayed with traditional maps and imagery datasets. If the mobile imagery from the same source overlaps, only some of the mobile imagery will be displayed. In this case, it is better to use the Mobile tab to correctly render all of the data. Changing this setting will require a restart.

The Sensor Point of Interest (SPI) has a menu item that when selected allows the SPI to be dragged around the radius to correct issues introduced by the magnetic compass in the Laser Range Finder. The red cone displays a 10 degree offset of either side of the reported shot to aid in correction.
The maximum delay between sending updates for the SPI point, if enabled (in seconds) even if the SPI is not modified. Moving a SPI point locally will generate updates immediately.
Enable Auto Zoom feature to display self and SPI in map view when tool is first launched
If enabled, a Night Vision enable/disable widget will appear on ATAK

In this version, the GRG tab has been fully migrated to the Overlay Manager.
GRG files, in TIF or KMZ file format, should be placed in the atak/grg folder on either the sdcard or the internal memory.

Imagery based map products (pfps, native, layers) should now be placed in the atak/imagery folder either on the sdcard or the internal memory.

Overlay products like KML, KMZ, LPT, DRW, etc should be placed in the atak/overlay folder either on the sdcard or internal memory.
Specifies the callsign for this device
Specifies the callsign, team, and role of this device

Touch to prepare the application for cloning purposes. Clears the callsign and device unique identifier, and then exits the application. Once the application exits, do not rerun. Clone the Android system. When the application is run on a cloned device, this information is recreated.
The unique identifer and callsign will be cleared in preparation for cloning this device.
The unique identifer and callsign have been cleared. The application will now be closed. Do not relaunch the application until the device has been cloned.

Reporting rate in seconds (e.g. once per 30 seconds when standing still) for unreliable protocols (e.g. multicast). Note: other events may also trigger reporting (e.g. a callsign change)
Minimum reporting rate in seconds (e.g. once per 20 seconds when moving slow) for unreliable protocols (e.g. multicast). Note: other events may also trigger reporting (e.g. a callsign change)
Maximum reporting rate in seconds (e.g. every other second when moving fast) for unreliable protocols (e.g. multicast). Note: other events may also trigger reporting (e.g. a callsign change)

Important note: This device does not have an accelerometer. This means that ATAK might not function correctly in all cases.

Important note: This device does not have an internal compass. ATAK will not be able to determine a direction when performing track up while moving slowly or standing still. In these cases, it will show North is UP.
Important note: This device does not have an internally provided GPS receiver. This means that ATAK can only receive GPS data from external sources.

Can be used to set up the source for the GPS data. By default it uses external GPS information is present otherwise it defaults back to the internal GPS.
Moving Maps and Situational Awareness for the Android OS

Many versions of the Android Operating System contain an issue where the operating system gets stuck scanning multimedia files (map data, videos). This will only work on some devices and operating systems. Unchecking this will attempt to restore the original state of the scanner. The scanner that will be disabled is the \'mediaserver\' and when stuck will cause significant battery drain.
Show traditional association line between the self marker and the desired impact point.

On newer devices from Samsung, the navigation bar (back, home, recent) hides when not in use. When navigation bar hiding is disabled, the resulting navigation bar is bright white. This constructs a faux navigation bar that persists on the screen and is not bright white. Do you wish to enable the faux Navigation Bar?

Continuous Rendering is the legacy model for updating graphics on the screen and has been replaced with a more efficient rendering mechanism. Enable this feature only if there are rendering issues observed when using the software.
Classic resection. Takes lines of bearing from observer\'s point to 2 or more landmarks
When there are landmarks you are able to identify and match to the map. Highest accuracy when angle between landmarks approaches 90 degrees

Metrics Logging is enabled to capture diagnostic information and usage details. Metric data may optionally be uploaded to TAK Server to help improve ATAK.
Allows for configuration of metrics report so that only the required information is gathered.
Enable usage and metrics data to be collected and recorded in directory: support/logs\nPlease note that this will cause an app performance penalty due to consumption of system resources.
Enable usage and metrics data to be sent to TAK Server periodically while app is running. This will consume higher than normal bandwidth.

If checked captures all incoming and outgoing Cursor on Target traffic and saves each message based on its event type into directory: tools/metrics/cot. Each message is saved under a subdirectory as an individual file [type]/[type]-timestamp.xml. This can be used to generate and refine XSD schemas.

If checked captures all incoming and outgoing Cursor on Target traffic and extracts only the nested details into directory: tools/metrics/details. Each detail is saved under a subdirectory as an individual file [element]/[element]-timestamp.xml. This can be used to generate and refine XSD schemas.
Details about app crashes are recorded in directory: support/logs
Manage advanced logging of debug and low level app data

Please note that logging and metrics collection will cause an app performance penalty. Care should be taken to only enable these settings during a diagnostic period, and should remain off during normal app usage due to consumption of system resources.

When selected, the Point-to-Point link on the system is considered high speed capable. This should not be enabled unless instructed. Newer radios are capable of supporting high speed tunnels that are point to point. Older radios support serial based point to point connections that are not high speed capable. For those older radios, turning this on will oversaturate link effectively disabling the capability.

The Digital Pointer (DP) has a menu item that when selected allows the DP to be dragged around the radius to correct issues introduced by the magnetic compass in the Laser Range Finder. The red cone displays a 10 degree offset of either side of the reported shot to aid in correction.

Use Your Location in the Background

ATAK asks for the ability to collect location in the background so that when users are running ATAK and background it to perform other activities, it can continue to report the precise location to team members either on a local network of via a TAK Server that the user has configured to use. The data is sent out to other team members to show the precise location of the individual helping with coordinating such things such as incident response, disaster relief, and personal safety.
\t1) This data is not sent to the developers of the application.\n\t2) ATAK does not collect location data when the app is not running, only when it is backgrounded.
This application requires the location permission to be set to \'Allow all of the time\'
